reviews.review: this is the part where he kills me
when life gives you lemons, you make your engineers build a combustible lemon and burn life's house down

A must play for anyone with a computer. It's a solid piece of media, and easily one of the titans of AAA games two generations ago. The mechanics are simple but the tests can get really hard, especially if you're playing the community made chambers which are a great addition to the game and really add that bit of extra content the game needs. The story isn't very long, as was the case with most games in this era, but it's interesting for the time it lasts and surprisingly has a good variety in environments for a game located solely in a science facility. The co-op half of the game is also a really great addition and not only makes the levels considerably more challenging, but allows for some really fun and satisfying moments finally solving a really tough test chamber. I don't know the price of this game offhand but, whatever it is, it's worth it. There really is no other game like it.

If there was ever such a thing as a perfect game, this would be it. Fantastic on absolutely every level, including visually, despite it being made back in 2011. This game is incredibly timeless and I'm sure will be delighting players for years to come.

A must play no matter if you've been playing games for decades or if this is your first one. All around absolutely stellar.
